page.title: 08HIGHAM FERRERS' GOVERNMENT
page.content:
The local government in Higham Ferrers consists of a Mayor and 16 Councilors. It is their job to help solve issues which concern the local community and regular meetings are held to discuss current problems and ideas.
The Mayor, who is elected for 1 year in office, is a very busy man because he works full time as well. However being Mayor can be very rewarding and a great honour. On the 3rd May 1985 it was the pleasant duty of the Mayor to welcome the Queen to Higham Ferrers.
The Mayor is very concerned about the damage being done to the old houses in Higham Ferrers because of the vast amount of traffic which thunders past each day. Therefore the Mayor and his Councilors are pleased about plans to build the A45 bypass.
